title: Is there a place where I can access UV maps of champions?
body: I have several LoL cosplays planned and UV maps really help with the creation of prop/armor/clothing patterns for me. There was a [Xayah map](https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/d/df/Xayah_Model_04.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170423010655) posted, which lead me to wonder if there are more out there I can take a peek at.

replies.body:
Hey Nooduls,
We don't have a repository of UV maps readily available for all champions/champion skins, but I would be able to get you some model shots of something particular if you're planning a cosplay! :)

That'd be really fantastic, thank you so much! I'm currently debating on whether to cosplay the new Infiltrator or Nightblade Irelia, so anything from either of those skins would be great.

Of course I've been heavily referencing the models available on lolking, I just also like to see how the designs look laid out flat

> [{quoted}](name=Nooduls,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=EHub7nmJ,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-04-16T21:01:57.201+0000)

> Of course I've been heavily referencing the models available on lolking, I just also like to see how the designs look laid out flat

Totally get ya! 

I talked to some modeling folks, and found out that we don't make UV maps available unless the artist has permission to openly post on their ArtStation, etc. BUT, I was able to hop in our tools and grab model shots from various angles. 

*I can also grab some in-game shots, if you're concerned about how it'd look on Summoner's Rift* 'cause any models - on LoLKing or what I'm posting here - won't have any sort of lighting applied. So, once you make your call on which skin you're looking to make, I can grab some in-game stuff, too! Just lemme know! ^^ 

https://imgur.com/IQECJ4q
https://imgur.com/936NojR

Happy crafting! :D

Alright, that's certainly good to know. These images are _great_ references and don't make my crappy laptop want to quit on life like lolking does. 

Thank you again for putting in the extra effort, I really appreciate it! :) I cant wait to start drafting up plans!

No, we don't provide the actual models/files, but can provide additional screenshots in different angles for those who are looking to create things like cosplay.
I think Riot should release these things more often. It will help cosplayers a great deal.

I used LoLking as *the* resource for animations and ingame models, it helps a lot when I wanted to draw something or visualize how someone poses for his abilities.

That's the closest thing I can think of, but an "official" one sounds like a *great* idea.
